intro: Ageratum odoratum, commonly known as the fragrant ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a strong, spicy scent. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens. Ageratum odoratum prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
